title: Add hotbar-only inventory and auto-loot mined blocks

requirements.text: Add a visible hotbar UI to the main game screen that displays the playerâ€™s collected mined blocks, and treat the hotbar as the only inventory for this MVP.

quotes: It should just go straight into the hot bar.

acceptanceCriteria: A hotbar is visible on the main game screen during gameplay.
The hotbar visually matches the existing mining UI theme (stone/amber styling) and does not obstruct the world grid or touch controls.
The hotbar clearly shows at least the two existing block types (dirt and stone) with a numeric count for each (starting at 0).

requirements.text: When a tile is fully mined (i.e., it transitions from a solid block to air), automatically add exactly 1 of that block type to the hotbar inventory immediately (no intermediate pickup step).

quotes: It should just go straight into the hot bar.

acceptanceCriteria: Mining a dirt tile until it breaks increases the Dirt count in the hotbar by 1.
Mining a stone tile until it breaks increases the Stone count in the hotbar by 1.
Partial damage (clicks that do not fully break the tile) does not change any hotbar counts.
Clicks on unrevealed tiles, non-air-adjacent tiles, or air tiles do not change hotbar counts.
Hotbar counts update immediately on the same interaction that breaks the tile.

requirements.text: Update the in-game HUD text (English) to mention that mined blocks automatically go straight into the hotbar.

quotes: It should just go straight into the hot bar.

acceptanceCriteria: HUD includes a short English sentence indicating mined blocks are automatically collected into the hotbar.
Existing movement and mining rule instructions remain accurate and readable.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not introduce any backend dependency for the hotbar in this change; keep it purely client-side state.
Keep the world generation and existing mining rules (fog-of-war + air-adjacent requirement) intact.
nonGoals: No item selection/active slot mechanics (e.g., equipping, placing blocks, using tools).
No expanded inventory UI beyond the visible hotbar.
No backend persistence of inventory across reloads/logins.
No crafting, shops, or resource types beyond existing dirt and stone.
